StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Destroy the ship. Desertion can not be tolerated, even from one of our best.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to intercept and destroy the stolen overlord, however, during the battle, some sort of giant space monster began emerging from the wormhole. Our surviving ships were able to collapse the wormhole, but one of the creatures managed to escape into our universe.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]One large space monster appears.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Dec
StringTable.String:
The Governor of {PLANETNAME} has begun acting very erratically. We have received reports of him issuing strange edicts to the colony, mandating city-wide parties. Other reports have spoken of mass hallucinations and citizens disappearing off the streets. Whatever this mad governor is up to seems to be working though, as {PLANETNAME} has had an amazing boost in production recently.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Production on {PLANETNAME} for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: This sounds insane. Replace the governor immediately.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Send investigators to determine if there is a method to the governor's madness.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Let the governor continue with his crazy plans. It seems to be working.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String:
We sent someone to replace the mad governor on {PLANETNAME}, but she vanished not long after her arrival. The existing governor has announced that his replacement was kidnapped by criminals, and vowed to find the culprits at any cost. In the meantime, the colony is reporting even higher productivity than before.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Additional +10% Production and -5% Growth on {PLANETNAME} for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Obviously the mad governor is behind the disappearance. Send in the military to remove him by force.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Well that's suspicious. Send in investigators to find out what's really going on.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Even higher productivity you say? Maybe we should just let him do his thing.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our forces have arrived on {PLANETNAME} and arrested the mad governor. They discovered that he had been drugging the entire population of the planet through the water supply - even himself. The drugs he used were formulated to "energize" the people, which they apparently did, aside from the small portion of the population that simply died. We should be able to return things to normal, but the planet's population will be going through withdrawal symptoms for some time.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25 Benevolent, -50% Growth on {PLANETNAME} for 10 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
The mad governor on {PLANETNAME} has continued to govern the planet using his unique methods, and as near as we can tell, everything seems to be working. The planet is more productive than ever, though there are questions of how long they will be able to keep it up, seeing as population growth has veered into negative territory. Still, we can always send them more population.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Production and -20% Growth on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_1f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Word of a colony-wide tragedy on {PLANETNAME} has just reached us. As it turns out the governor there had been drugging the population for some time with various experimental substances designed to boost the planet's production. Although this seemed to be working for some time, the process has since gone too far, people literally working themselves to death. The planet has since broken out in to a global riot, killing the governor and most of his officials. Things seem to have calmed down since then, though we expect production and morale to be low for quite some time.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Production and Morale for 50 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our investigators have reached {PLANETNAME}, and been welcomed by the mad governor. Most of the team seems convinced that the governor's behavior, however erratic, is h+DR192armless. The ones still around, at any rate - two members of the investigation team were set upon by street thugs and murdered not long ago. The governor assures us that the killers will be caught.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Production and -5% Growth on {PLANETNAME} for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Order the remaining investigators to relieve the governor of duty. Bring him back to our homeworld to face charges.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Our investigators have been compromised. Send in the military to remove the governor by force.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Accidents happen. If the rest of the investigators are ok with him, let him do his thing.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The investigators on {PLANETNAME} have arrested the governor there. They discovered that he had been drugging the entire population of the planet through the water supply - even himself. The drugs he used were formulated to "energize" the people, which they apparently did, aside from the small portion of the population that simply died. We should be able to return things to normal, but the planet's population will be going through withdrawal symptoms for some time.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25 Pragmatic and -50% Growth on {PLANETNAME} for 10 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String:
Productivity on {PLANETNAME} continues to soar, but reports of strange disappearances, mass hallucinations, and widespread erratic behavior still persist. More troubling, the growth rate of the planet has almost completely stalled.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Production and -50% Growth on {PLANETNAME} for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Send investigators to make sure the mad governor is not doing any permanent damage.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Doing nothing seems to have worked pretty well so far, let's stick with that.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: We need to find out what this guy is up to so we can reproduce it on all our worlds.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The governor on {PLANETNAME} admitted that he has been drugging the entire colony for some time. After much experimentation, he discovered a simple stimulant that can be introduced into the water supply, which makes people much more productive. With some help from our researchers, we have been able to make sure this new stimulant is safe for consumption, and will continue the experiment. The only downside appears to be that people are now too busy to reproduce.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Production and -10% Growth on {PLANETNAME} for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
The governor on {PLANETNAME} admitted that he has been drugging the entire colony for some time. After much experimentation, he discovered a simple stimulant that can be introduced into the water supply, which makes people much more productive. The most recent version of it proven to be remarkably safe, the only observed downside being that people are too busy to reproduce. We think with a bit of work we can modify this to be employed on all our colonies.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Global +10% Production and -10% Growth for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Dec
StringTable.String: We have noticed a large spike in illegal trade, both between our own worlds and involving goods from outside our borders. Rumor has it a pirate starbase called the Dark Hub has been established and is acting as a sort of criminal headquarters for surrounding worlds. If we're just noticing this now, it's likely been going for quite some time. Who knows what dangerous trades are occurring. Or how many credits we're missing out on.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Find this starbase then capture and arrest any criminals.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Find this starbase so we can track down and learn more about this criminal syndicate.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Have our agents infiltrate and take over the base. We want a black market at our disposal.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our forces have found the location of the Dark Hub, but we have discovered that for the most part, it is a thriving civilian starbase. Though the criminal influence is obvious, most of the population of the starbase are simple civilians, the vast majority from our own worlds. We are hopeful that this will make it easier to isolate the criminal element and remove it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Make it known that if the criminal activity stops immediately they can become a legitimate trading hub.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Try and convince the locals to turn over the criminal elements.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Seize control of the station and root out all the criminals.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The offer of amnesty on the Dark Hub has been surprisingly successful. Some of the more notorious criminal elements seem to have disappeared from the base, but everyone else has been right on board. We are now in possession of a thriving trading base that should only become more profitable in the future.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Benevolent, Award Dark Hub starbase, +25% to all trading income for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to convince most of the population of the Dark Hub starbase to cooperate and turn over the criminal syndicate that operated there. Unfortunately, many of the criminals fled the station in well-armed ships before we could move in. The remaining population of the base is afraid of retaliation from these pirates, and has asked for our protection. In exchange for a new starbase, that seems reasonable.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Dark Hub starbase, +25% to all trading income for 50 turns, some Pirates appear.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
While a small portion of the population of the Dark Hub seemed willing to turn over the dangerous criminals on the base, those criminals were better armed than we first expected. A short, bloody conflict quickly settled the matter. Not in our favor. The criminal syndicate is now firmly in charge of the base and has brought in several more pirate ships to help protect it.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Dark Hub Pirate base is revealed in your territory, along with several pirate vessels.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our forces have taken control of the Dark Hub starbase, but unfortunately the leaders of the crime syndicate were able to escape in heavily armed ships before we arrived. This at least allowed us to capture the base intact, though the people who made it such a valuable trading hub have obviously all vanished.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Dark Hub starbase and some Pirates appear.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_1f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Although our focus were able to briefly take control of the Dark Hub starbase, the leaders of the crime syndicate who operated it managed to escape in heavily armed ships before we arrived. These ships immediately turned on the base and destroyed it not long after. The civilian population of the base was completely lost, as well as many of our troops. In addition, the syndicate ships that escaped have begun raiding in our territory.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Several pirate vessels appear in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our forces have found the location of the Dark Hub, but we have discovered that for the most part, it is a thriving civilian starbase. Though the criminal influence is obvious, most of the population of the starbase are simple civilians, the vast majority from our own worlds. We are hopeful that this will make it easier to isolate the criminal element and remove it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Try and convince the locals to turn over the criminal elements.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Seize control of the station and root out all the criminals.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Seize the starbase, space the criminals, and evict anyone who was supporting them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our forces were able to take control of the Dark Hub starbase. The civilian population quickly turned on the criminal syndicates who ran the place, and not only helped us capture the base but also several of the pirate ships stationed there. The only bad news is that most of the people who made the base such a valuable trading hub have been killed.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Dark Hub starbase along with 1 frigate, and 2 Battle Axes.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our agents have located the Dark Hub starbase, and begun infiltrating the local crime syndicate running it. Unfortunately, the base seems to have a large civilian population that continues to trade with many of our worlds. This may make it more difficult to take over the operation without a word of our involvement leaking out to the general population.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Yeah, it sounds like too much work. Space the criminals and evict anyone who was supporting them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Continuing in full control of our own crime network will be worth the risk of bad PR.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Send in the military, take anything valuable, and destroy the rat's nest before it grows larger.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our agents have fully taken over the criminal syndicate operating out of the Dark Hub starbase. It was messy work, but we now have a backchannel into their trading network and will soon gain access to a variety of lucrative deals and outlawed technologies. This arrangement should prove very profitable at least as long as we are able to keep it a secret.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Dark Hub starbase, +10% Global income and Research for 100 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our agents have been uncovered while trying to take over the Dark Hub syndicate. The crime lord running the Dark Hub has declared it a pirate sanctuary, and is calling for reinforcements from criminal networks around the galaxy. Furthermore, he has made it well known that we were willing to support continued criminal activity as long as we could profit from it. This has not been good for our reputation in the galaxy.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-1 Diplomacy, Award Dark Hub starbase, several Pirates spawn in the territory[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our forces have destroyed the Dark Hub starbase. Although the base was vigorously defended by both its civilian and criminal population, they were ultimately no match for our fleet. From the wreckage we were able to seize a large stash of credits, as well as several valuable resources that were being smuggled out of the base.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Malevolent, +2500 Credits and +10 Arnor Spice.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Dark Hub - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Dark_Hub_Choice_3f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our forces have destroyed the Dark Hub starbase. Although the base was vigorously defended by both its civilian and criminal population, they were ultimately no match for our fleet. Unfortunately, most of the smartest criminals managed to escape before we arrived, taking with them most of the valuables thought to be on the base.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Several Pirates spawn in the territory[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Dec
StringTable.String: Colonists on {PLANETNAME} have found the remains of an ancient spacecraft buried beneath the surface of the planet, technologically far beyond anything we have. Inside the ship lie the remains of thousands of alien creatures, all found with a strange creature buried deep within their abdomen. Strangely the creatures inside the corpses appear to be in some sort of hibernation. One local scientist realized that the creatures and the corpses used to live in some sort of symbiotic relationship and has asked permission to try and wake up one of the symbiotes.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: If we can revive a lost race we should do what we can. Just be careful.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: We can not risk any sort of biological contamination. Tell them to focus on studying the ship.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Try and wake up one of the symbiotes and have it bond with a local "volunteer".

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scientists were able to wake one of the symbiotes, though initially, they were not able to communicate with it at all. However, after an accident in the lab, the Symbiote infected one of them. To the surprise of everyone he survived and has bonded with the Symbiote. Now the scientist claims to contain both his own and the Symbiote's consciousness and knowledge. "They" have already been of great assistance explaining the technology locked away in the ancient ship.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: This is very concerning. Find a way to remove the creature from our scientist.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Interesting. Ask some more researchers to volunteer for this bonding.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have been able to remove the creature from the scientist, but unfortunately he has begun suffering from some sort of mental withdrawal, and is now nearly catatonic. The governor of {PLANETNAME} was greatly disturbed by this and has ordered all the remaining symbiotes destroyed. With the ancient ship now freed of these creatures, our researchers have been able to make several breakthroughs.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Benevolent, +15% Research and Ship Construction on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our scientists, now augmented with symbiotes, have begun making incredible breakthroughs while studying the ancient ship. Not only that, their enhanced intelligence has led to a corresponding increase in all research being conducted on the colony.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+50% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Many of our scientists were eager to volunteer to bond with the symbiotes, and at first things looked promising. Unfortunately at one point, all communication from the scientists on the ship was cut, and the ship itself reactivated, apparently at the hands of the scientists themselves. Shortly after, the ship took off, tearing a large hole in the colony as it did so. Before we could intercept it, it vanished into some sort of controlled wormhole. Few lives were lost in the disaster, but the resulting dust plume will be doing environmental damage for years to come.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-15% Production and Morale on {PLANETNAME} for 100 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: The ancient ship on {PLANETNAME} has begun to reveal its mysteries. But the crew studying it have begun to act strangely - in fact, they seem to be making far too much progress studying the ship. Wild, speculative predictions that are always revealed to be accurate. The colonial government has grown suspicious.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Withdraw the crew studying the ship. Make sure they have not been compromised.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Someone has been waking up Symbiotes. Lock down the site to avoid further contamination.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: We need to act fast. Send in the military to sterilize the ship.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The crew has been safely returned from the ancient ship, and indeed we have found all of them have been infected with the alien symbiotes. In worse news, any attempt to remove the creatures would be fatal. The upside is that the symbiotes seem to greatly boost the intelligence of their hosts, and the crew now claim to have ancient memories in their heads. Otherwise, they seem normal, as long as they are kept away from the ship. We have transferred the infected crew to a remote research center, where they can continue to work in well-guarded safety.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+50% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
After sealing off the ancient ship, we have made contact with the research team. They admit that they have all bonded with the symbiotes, and that these creatures mean us no harm. Our researchers claim that they are still themselves, just now with the memories of ancient beings inside them. The local government has agreed to let them continue to study and repair the ancient ship, as long as they continue to share with us what they learn.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Pragmatic +15% Research and Ship Construction on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
While sealing off the site of the ancient ship, the compromised crew activated some sort of energy barrier, cutting off all communications to the ship. Shortly after losing contact with our team, the entire ship came to life and took off, tearing a large hole in the colony. Before we could intercept it vanished into some sort of controlled wormhole. The ship and all its knowledge have been lost, and the resulting dust plume will be doing environmental damage for years to come.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-15% Production and Morale for 100 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our soldiers were able to capture the ship, despite attempts by the research crew to stop them by raising some sort of energy field around the ship. Fortunately, many of our forces had already entered the ship when the field went up, and were able to eliminate the infected scientists and lower the field. Fearing contamination, the military has since burned all the remaining symbiotes on the ship, leaving just the hardware behind for us to study and adapt as our own.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Research and 25% Ship Construction on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: We have successfully bonded one of the Symbiotes with a local thief who will not be missed. Strangely the results of the bond have been to make the thief much stronger and smarter. Our scientists believe that these Symbiotes greatly augment the talent of their host while retaining the memories of both individuals.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Interesting. Ask some of our researchers to volunteer. They're smarter and less thief-like.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Ask for volunteers from the best and brightest of the colony's population.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: These Symbiotes seem too valuable to waste. Send the entire lot of them to the military.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Recruiting the best and brightest of the colony's population to bond with the symbiotes has proven very effective. While the more scientifically minded of the volunteers seem to become obsessed with studying the lost ship itself, other symbiote-colonist pairs seem content to do anything else. Apparently the race they were formerly bonded with was obsessed with technology, and are they now very happy to be working on other things.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Research, Morale and Production on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our military on {PLANETNAME} has made good use of the alien symbiotes. These symbiotes now augment our soldiers, engineers, and even several of our best commanders. Furthermore, technology from the ancient ship itself has made it possible to greatly increase our ship construction and overall defensive capabilities.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Resistance and +25% Ship Construction on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Symbiotes - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Symbionts_Choice_3f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Shortly after turning over the symbiotes to the military, {PLANETNAME} was rocked by a huge explosion. It was discovered some of the newly bonded engineers were secretly doing experiments on the ancient ship, apparently trying to bring some sort of weapon system back online. The weapon worked rather too well, blowing up the buried ship, and a large portion of the planet. The resulting dust plume will be doing environmental damage for years to come.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-15% Production and Morale for 100 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Dec
StringTable.String:
The governor of {PLANETNAME} has informed us that engineers have discovered a thin layer of Thulium just below the surface of the colony. It appears to cover the entire planet. They believe they can recover a great deal of this rare resource, but have not been able to find a way to mine it that does not devastate the surface, making it almost unusable for any other purpose.
{PLANETNAME} is home to a thriving colony and is known for its natural beauty. Our scientists warn that mining this resource to its fullest would eventually convert the world to a barren wasteland.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: We can find Thulium in many places, but not successful colonies. Leave the Thulium where it is.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Mine as much as we can without damaging the environment too much.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: We have other planets, and Thulium is very useful. Strip mine the planet.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Despite banning the mining of Thulium on {PLANETNAME}, criminal elements have established small mines in remote locations around the planet. Thulium from the world is beginning to show up on the black market. These illegal mines are also having an adverse effect on the planet, the amount of Thulium particulates in the atmosphere having risen to potentially dangerous levels.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Crack down on the smugglers. We must stop the mining.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Offer the smugglers amnesty if they obey our standards, and sell us the Thulium they recover.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to stop the smuggling ring on {PLANETNAME} before they did too much environmental damage, and even recovered some of the Thulium they had mined.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Benevolent, +5 Thulium.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
By offering the smugglers on {PLANETNAME} legitimacy, we were able to create a small but relatively safe Thulium mining guild. In fact the now ex-smugglers have become so protective of their monopoly, that they have proven quite effective at making sure no one else opens a new mine on the planet.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Thulium every other turn, and +10% Planetary Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our offer of legitimacy to the smugglers looked like it was going to work, but unfortunately once word leaked out that we were considering an amnesty, hundreds of new mining operations started on the surface. With some help from the military, we were able to shut these new mines down, but a great deal of environmental damage had already been done.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Morale on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our engineers on {PLANETNAME} have presented several options to mine the newly discovered Thulium layer.
Option 1. Use nanobots in a subsurface honeycomb pattern, preserving the surface integrity of the planet.
Option 2. Establish smaller mines in remote unpopulated areas.
Option 3. Surround the existing population centers with domes. We protect the air quality and enough usable land for them to continue to survive.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Use the Nanobots, Option 1.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Remote mining sounds promising, let's go with option 2.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Option 3, the colonists will adapt, and Thulium is rare enough to be worth it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The nanobot mining on {PLANETNAME} has been very successful. The environment seems to be unaffected, and we should be able to continue extracting Thulium for years to come.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Thulium every other turn on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2b_Dec
StringTable.String:
The nanobot mining on {PLANETNAME} has run into some complications. Apparently our engineers over-estimated the structural integrity of the Thulium cavities that they were creating. The end result has been repeated earthquakes and increased volcanic activity, and all the disruption you'd expect from that.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Thulium every 10 turns, -10% Production, -10% morale on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our remote mines on {PLANETNAME} have begun to yield results. With proper safety and environmental precautions, we see no reason why they cannot continue to operate for years to come. We are having some problems with environmental activists, but for the most part the rest of the population seem convinced that we are being safe.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-5% Morale and +1 Thulium every other turn on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
After a heated debate, our security forces on {PLANETNAME} have convinced the colonists to allow us to create the Dome system that will allow for wide spread Thulium mining. Planetary morale has taken a big hit, but our Thulium mines are now operating at full capacity.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Thulium every 5 turns and -10% Morale on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_2f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our plan to move the population of {PLANETNAME} into domes has not gone well. The population is in near revolt, and has declared war on anyone trying to mine the Thulium. This has lead to the outright murder of many of our engineers. We do not see any way forward with mining other than the institution of martial law, up to and including arresting almost the entire population of the colony.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Production, -50% Morale for 50 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mining efforts on {PLANETNAME} have begun to pay off. But the population is not happy, the mining having led to high levels of Thulium particulates in the atmosphere. People are starting to get sick. We think we can limit the environmental impact, but the more we do the less of the resource we will be able to recover.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Limit the mining to remote areas, to avoid too much atmospheric damage.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Build domes around the existing settlements to protect them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Strip Mining - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Strip_Mining_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Thulium production on {PLANETNAME} is booming. The local population seems to have taken the hint and has begun migrating off the planet in record numbers. At the current rate, our miners will have the entire planet at their disposal within a few short years.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Thulium per 5 turns, -10% Morale and -50% Growth on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Dec
StringTable.String: One of our survey ships has recovered a huge Precursor artifact drifting through deep space. After some investigation, they have determined that it is some sort of gravitational power source. It appears to require a planet to operate, but the potential power it could generate is staggering. That said, we are not sure what the effect on the planet itself would be.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: It sounds dangerous, leave it where we found it. But send a research crew to dismantle it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Tow it to a dead world so we can test it there.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Take it to the nearest colony and see if they can make it work.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: While we have learned much by dismantling the Precursor power plant. At its core appears to be a small contained singularity that reacts to other large gravitational fields. The shield that encapsulates the singularity is like nothing we have ever seen before, controlled by an artificial intelligence operating on the fastest computing device we have ever encountered. The rest of the structure is effectively a giant turbine meant to capture this gravitational force generated by the singularity. Unfortunately while disassembling the artifact was within our capability, putting it back together appears to be impossible.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Let's try our best to reproduce the phenomena that power the device.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Study the AI controlling the device. Maybe it can help show us what makes it so powerful.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Study the shielding surrounding the Singularity and try to reproduce it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers have been able to reproduce the technology behind the Precursor power plant, at least on a small scale. This new Gravitation power system should be a great boon to our civilization's production, galaxy-wide.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Pragmatic and +5% Global Production.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers at the Precursor power plant have managed to isolate the artificial intelligence controlling the device. With some convincing, it has now agreed to help us in our research. Unfortunately, when this happened, it ejected the shield singularity into a nearby star. We were forced to flee the area with only the AI in tow. The rest of the artifact has been destroyed.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% global Research for 100 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
While studying the artificial intelligence controlling the Precursor power plant, our researchers seem to have done something to threaten it. From what we have been able to piece together from communication fragments, the AI deliberately dropped the containment shield around the singularity, causing the artifact and all of our researchers to be sucked into the newly forming black hole.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-5% global Research for 10 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have been able to mostly reproduce the shield technology being used by the Precursor power plant, and should be able to use it to greatly enhance the shield systems of our own ships. Unfortunately, the AI controlling the shield seems to have figured out what we were trying to do and shut down the shield around the singularity. The artifact - and most of our researchers - have since been sucked into a newly formed black hole.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Shield Strength to all ships.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_1f_Dec
StringTable.String:
While trying to reproduce the shield technology being used by the Precursor power plant, the AI controlling the shield seems to have figured out what we were trying to do and shut down the shield around the singularity. The artifact - and most of our researchers - have since been sucked into a newly formed black hole.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-5% global Research for 10 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: We found a dead world to test the Precursor Power Plant on. Upon activation, the artifact created a powerful force field that surrounded the planet. The field appears to be impenetrable, but generating huge amounts of power we can tap for just about any use. Unfortunately, the bond with the planet seems to be unbreakable, short of destroying the power planet entirely. So if we want to use this power we will need to do it here.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Establish a research base near the planet, and use it to power our research.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Use the power to charge batteries that can boost production throughout our civilization.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Build a munitions base near the planet, and use the power to create weapons.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our newly constructed research base near the Precursor power plant has gone fully into operation. Despite its remote location, the access to nearly unlimited power has made it one of our most prolific research centers.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% global Research for 100 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our newly constructed manufacturing base near the Precursor power plant has gone fully into operation. They have begun producing powerful power cells charged by the artifact, and are now shipping these to manufacturing centers throughout our civilization.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% global Manufacturing for 100 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Construction on our base near the Precursor power plant was going well until the plant itself turned on some sort of previously unknown defense system. Our forces in the area were immediately disintegrated by a powerful beam drawn from an energy source hidden somewhere within the planet. We have not been able to enter the system since.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-5% global Research for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our newly constructed munitions base near the Precursor power plant has gone fully into operation, and begun producing powerful explosives and power cells for our beam weapons. We have already begun distributing them throughout the fleet.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% to Missile and Beam weapons on all our ships.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Upon its arrival near {PLANETNAME} our researchers activated the Precursor power plant and watched as the artifact instantly created a powerful force field that surrounded the planet. The good news is the field generates huge amounts of power we should be able to tap for just about any use. The bad news is the field is impenetrable and {PLANETNAME}'s population is trapped inside. Currently, they seem to be unharmed and functioning normally, but they will never leave the planet as long as the artifact is active. Unfortunately, the bond with the planet seems to be unbreakable by anything short of destroying the power planet itself.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Destroy the artifact and free the population of the planet.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Divert all power to the shipyard and let the population know their sacrifice will not be in vain.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
With some luck, we were able to remove the Precursor power plant that had sealed off {PLANETNAME}. When we opened fire on the device it seems to have gone into some sort of lockdown mode, and shut down the shield. Before we could investigate further, it had begun to move out of the system at hyper-warp speeds.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Pragmatic and +30% Morale on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have diverted power from the Precursor power plant surrounding {PLANETNAME} to the local shipyard. This has led to an amazing production boost, far greater than anything we expected. Unfortunately, the energy field is having some adverse effects on the population of the planet. As in, we don't expect them to be around much longer.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Ship Construction, -50% Population and -50% Growth on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Precursor Power Plant - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Power_Plant_Choice_3d_Dec
StringTable.String:
When the citizens of {PLANETNAME} realized we were going to leave them sealed inside the energy field generated by the Precursor power plant, they, as expected, did not take it well. After some hasty construction, they built a ship capable of reaching the artifact on the inside of the shield, and attempted to blow it up with nuclear charges. Immediately the artifact went into some sort of protective mode, and shut down the field before moving out of the system at hyper-warp speeds, taking a large portion of the planet's atmosphere with it.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-10% Population on {PLANETNAME}, and -25% Morale for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Dec
StringTable.String: A notorious smuggler based out of {PLANETNAME} let it be known that he wants to start a legitimate shipping concern. The smuggler is known for being a genius with logistics and has an uncanny ability to acquire rare items and resources. Unfortunately, he also has a reputation for being willing to work with anyone, including several criminal syndicates and pirate groups.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Let him know we are willing to consider it if he helps arrest the more notorious of his former customers.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Allow him to start trading openly, but keep a real close eye on him.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Make sure he knows that anything is possible for the right price.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: The smuggler on {PLANETNAME} has already established a thriving concern, and at this point there is no evidence he's engaged in anything shady. But none of the information he provided us about his former customers has panned out. We are not sure if the criminals have just gone into hiding when he flipped on them or if the information itself was false.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Let's take him at his word for now.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Tell him if he does not provide some useful information he will be spending his retirement in a cell.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Send an agent to infiltrate this new business and find out if he is truly on the up and up.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Much to our surprise, the smuggler on {PLANETNAME} appears to have gone fully legitimate. Criminal activity in the area has been greatly reduced. The colony's trade income has spiked, and the overall economy of the planet is looking much better. Apparently, every once in a while, someone can genuinely change their heart.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Benevolent, +5% Global trade income, +25% Colony Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Much to our surprise, the smuggler on {PLANETNAME} appears to have gone fully legitimate. Unfortunately, it appears his former clients were not impressed with his life choice, and only a few days after his new trading concern began did they brutally murder him in his mansion. Many of his former employees have also gone missing, though whether they were fellow victims or the perpetrators we may never know.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Colony Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
After the application of some pressure, the smuggler on {PLANETNAME} has admitted that he did not provide entirely accurate information on the identity of the worst of his former clients. With some assurance that his safety would be guaranteed, we were able to convince him to provide a little more, and with this information we were able to essentially shut down all the organized crime on and around {PLANETNAME}.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5% Global trade income, +25% Colony Income and Morale on {PLANETNAME} for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our agents have worked their way into the inner circles of the smuggler on {PLANETNAME}'s new trade concern. The smuggler is indeed trying to go legit, but has been holding back information on his former clients out of concern for his life. With some work our agents were able to find the names and locations of most of these criminals, and we have since been able to use this to shut down most of the organized crime on and around {PLANETNAME}.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5% Global trade income, +25% Colony Income and Morale on {PLANETNAME} for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_1f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our agents have worked their way into the inner circles of the smuggler on {PLANETNAME}'s new trade concern. The smuggler is indeed trying to go legit, but has been holding back information on his former clients out of concern for his life. Our agents began trying to find the names and locations of these criminals, but were halted when a corrupt member of local law enforcement tipped off these villains. Shortly after, the entire block where the smuggler's offices were located was leveled from orbit by a pirate vessel, which then fled the system. Neither the smuggler or our agents made it out of the dust cloud.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Colony Income on {PLANETNAME} and a single pirate ship spawns in our territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: The smuggler on {PLANETNAME} has already established a thriving concern and is bringing in quite a lot of money to the colony. However there have been reports that his people are still meeting pirates near the colony, though no actual criminal activity has been observed yet.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Tell him to provide some useful information on these pirates or he will be spending his retirement in a cell.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Send an agent to infiltrate the new business and find out if he is on the up and up.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Have our people pose as pirates and try to get him to sell them some weapons.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Posing as pirates, our agents have attempted to purchase weapons from the smuggler on {PLANETNAME}. Although they were repeatedly refused, they were eventually contacted by one of the smuggler's top people, who claimed that he could help them. Our forces immediately arrested the contact, who admitted that he was working on his own, and planning on murdering the smuggler and taking over his business. The now ex-smuggler was so pleased by our actions, that he has agreed to provide additional information that have allowed us to virtually shut down all the organized crime remaining on or around {PLANETNAME}.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5% Global trade income, +25% Colony Income and Morale on {PLANETNAME} for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: The smuggler on {PLANETNAME} has provided us with a healthy retainer to guarantee his behavior. Much to our surprise he's already established what appears to be a legitimate and thriving concern, bringing in quite a profit to the colony. However there have been reports that his people have been meeting pirates near the colony, though no actual criminal activity has been observed yet.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Send an agent to infiltrate the new business and find out if he is truly on the up and up.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Have our people pose as pirates and try to get him to sell them some weapons.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Let him know that we really don't care what he does as long as we get a cut.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Though the smuggler swears that he is now a legitimate businessman, we still don't care. The arrangement is working regardless, and he regularly sends us small presents to make sure that we know our protection of his new trade concern is appreciated.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Arnor Spice every 10 turns +10% Colony Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Change of Heart - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Smuggler_Choice_3f_Dec
StringTable.String:
The smuggler swears that he is now a legitimate businessman, and has refused to pay any more of what he considers to be protection money. Luckily the local authorities were happy to arrest him on past charges, and we were able to salvage some useful assets from his estate before he was executed.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Colony Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Dec
StringTable.String: One of our most preeminent scientists has gone missing on {PLANETNAME}. Normally we would leave this to the local authorities, but she was currently working on a revolutionary new terraforming technology capable of terraforming continents, and maybe even planets, almost instantly. Our biggest concern is that in the wrong hands this technology could be a terrible weapon. She was last seen in the local shipyard attempting to hire a ship. We don't know if she found one, and if she did where she has gone.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Send investigators to help the authorities find out where she was trying to go when she vanished.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Send researchers to investigate. If this technology can be weaponized, we need it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: The locals can't handle this. Send someone to the shipyard to find out where she went.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: The local authorities on {PLANETNAME} have discovered that our missing scientist had been receiving death threats from a radical group claiming that she was playing god. They believe she was trying to escape the planet with her research before they could act. Her lab has also since been ransacked and her research destroyed. At the same time, our investigators have found the ship she left on. It is currently orbiting a nearby dead world. We have no idea if she is on the ship as a passenger or a prisoner.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Contact the ship and make sure she is safe.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Benevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Contact the ship, and order them to turn over the scientist or we will come and get her.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Capture the ship, and arrest everyone. We can sort out the details later.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have made contact with the captain of the ship carrying the missing scientist. He claims that the scientist is on board willingly, and that she is simply looking for planets that they might test a prototype terraforming device on. The scientist has been transferred to our ship, along with the prototype device. She was very concerned to learn that her lab had been ransacked but assured us that she has backups of all her research with her.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Benevolent, New Prototype Ultra-Terraformer improvement unlocked, 1 per planet.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1b_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have made contact with the captain of the ship carrying the missing scientist. At first, he claimed the scientist was on board willingly, but when we asked to speak to her, he attempted to flee. Our forces tried to disable the ship, but something they were working on must have been activated when we opened fire. The ship exploded in an immense shockwave, destroying both the ship and our own forces instantly. When we sent another vessel to the system to check for survivors, they found a brand new habitable planet near where the ship had been.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New low-level planet discovered[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have made contact with the captain of the ship carrying the missing scientist. At first he claimed that the scientist was on board willingly, but when we insisted on speaking to her the ship attempted to flee. Fortunately for us, the missing scientist had disabled their hyperdrive, and we were able to capture the ship. The scientist has been transferred to our ship, along with various prototype devices. She explained that when the captain of the ship realized who and what she was, he locked her in her quarters. He was in the process of taking bids for her and her technology on the black market when we arrived.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New Prototype Ultra-Terraformer improvement unlocked, 1 per planet.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to capture the ship carrying the missing scientist. After disabling the ship, our boarding party found the scientist locked in her quarters and guarded by several crew members. When she was freed, the scientist admitted that she was trying to hire a ship so they could survey planets to test a prototype terraforming device on. Unfortunately, when the captain of the ship realized who she was, he locked her in her quarters.He was in the process of taking bids for her and her technology on the black market when we arrived.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award 1 freighter, New Prototype Ultra-Terraformer improvement unlocked, 1 per planet.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers have reached {PLANETNAME}. However before they arrived, the missing scientist's lab had been ransacked, all of her research apparently destroyed. She had also apparently been receiving death threats from a radical group claiming that she was playing god.
They did find what appears to be a fully functional prototype of her device locked in a hidden room. As we had heard the device is designed to terraform an entire planet. Our team believes that with some time they may be able to figure out how it works.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Destroy the device, this technology is obviously far too dangerous.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Have them study the device, and try and reproduce the lost research.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Test the prototype device on a nearby dead world.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers have managed to destroy the prototype terraforming device on {PLANETNAME}. We were fortunate that a member of our team had worked with the missing scientist in the past, and knew how to do this safely. If done wrong, the experimental power core inside might have ruptured, causing a shockwave that would have "reprogrammed" every living thing on the planet's surface.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Benevolent, +25% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers have made several breakthroughs while studying the prototype terraforming device. While they have not been able to reproduce the planet-wide effect, they have been able to produce a more localized wave that could terraform a small continent almost instantly.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New Prototype Ultra-Terraformer improvement unlocked, 1 per planet.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
When attempting to disassemble the prototype terraforming device on {PLANETNAME}, our researchers have apparently caused a horrible accident. The device triggered accidentally, sending out a shockwave that reprogrammed all the biological matter on the planet, killing everyone instantly. If there is a silver lining to this horrible tragedy, the planet itself has been left mostly intact and now contains far more livable land.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]5 tiles added to {PLANETNAME}, Population reduced by 90%.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to find a dead planet in the Goldilocks zone of a nearby solar system, perfect for testing the prototype device on. As advertised, the device worked almost instantly and transformed the planet into a livable world in less then a week. Unfortunately, by using the device we no longer have it to study, and our best scientists still don't have any idea how it worked.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New High-level planet discovered[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our investigators have reached {PLANETNAME}, and have found the ship she left the shipyard on. The ship in question belongs to a known arms dealer with connections to several foreign powers, and is currently orbiting a dead world. We have no idea if she is on the ship as a passenger or a prisoner. At the same time, the local authorities have informed us that before the scientist vanished she was receiving death threats from a radical group claiming she was playing god.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Disable the ship, and order them to turn over the scientist immediately.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Capture the ship, and arrest everyone, we can sort out the details later.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Destroy the ship. Better safe than sorry.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Falha

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our forces attempted to disable the ship carrying the missing scientist, but something they were working on must have been activated when we opened fire. The ship exploded in an immense shockwave, destroying both the ship and our own forces instantly. When we sent another vessel to the system to check for survivors, they found a brand new habitable planet near where the ship had been.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New low-level planet discovered[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Missing Scientist - Successo

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Missing_Scientist_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
It certainly seems that they were up to no good. When we opened fire on the vessel carrying the missing scientist, it immediately exploded in an immense shockwave, destroying both the ship and our forces instantly. When we sent another vessel to the system to check for survivors, they found a brand new habitable planet near where the ship had been.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New low-level planet discovered[/COLOR]
